quiz.text:
This type of unemployment tends to be a long-term feature of a country. Underdeveloped countries suffer from this type of unemployment on account of the vicious circle of poverty. Lack of developed resources and their underutilization, high population growth, backward, even primitive state of technology, low capital formation, etc. are the major causes of this type of unemployment in underdeveloped economies.

Which type of unemployment is discussed in the passage?
options: Structural Unemployment
Disguised Unemployment
Chronic Unemployment
Seasonal Unemployment
Casual Unemployment

quiz.text: Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) is released by which of the following agency?
options: Ministry of Information and Broadcasting
NITI Aayog
National Statistical Office
Ministry of Home Affairs
None of the above

quiz.text: The term “Open Unemployment” is used when:
options: People are not willing to work
People are willing but unable to get work
People leave their jobs in search of better ones
People get the jobs but no regular payments
None of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following statements: 1) Disguised unemployment is most commonly found unemployment in farm sector in India 2) Small size of landholdings and joint family system are some of the factors behind disguised unemployment 3) Disguised unemployment is only found in developing and least developed countries Which among the above is / are correct statements?
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Employment that arises during the phases of boom, recession, depression and recovery is the typical characteristics of which type of unemployment?
options: Frictional Unemployment
Cyclical Unemployment
Structural Unemployment
Disguised Unemployment
None of the above

quiz.text: A situation in which employed people are contributing to production less than they are capable of is termed as:
options: Under employment
Chronic unemployment
Cyclical unemployment
Frictional Unemployment
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is the correct formula to calculate the Worker Population Ratio (WPR)?
options: WPR = (No. of unemployed persons/Total Population) * 1000
WPR = (No. of employed persons/Total Population) * 1000
WPR = (Labour Force/Total Population) * 1000
WPR = (No. of people seeking employment/Total Population) * 1000
None of the above

quiz.text: The National Statistical Office (NSO) falls under which of the following Ministry of the Government of India?
options: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
Ministry of Finance
Ministry of Commerce and Industry
Ministry of Home Affairs
None of the above

quiz.text:
A new study by the Pew Research Center estimates that the COVID-19 pandemic has had a disproportionately deleterious impact on living standards in India and China in 2020, with the sharp economic contraction in the former pushing as many as 7.5 crore people into the ranks of the poor (those who earn $2 or less a day). In absolute terms, the number of poor in India is posited to have swelled to 13.4 crores, reversing the gains made in the preceding nine years when the country cut the number of poor by more than three-fourths to an estimated 7.8 crore in 2019. The latest report once again spotlights the widening inequality in India, exacerbated by the pandemic, as the lower-income populations have disproportionately borne the brunt of job and income losses in the wake of the multiple lockdowns resulting in poor health, lack of education, inadequate living standard, etc. The fiscal policy response to redress this massive increase in precarity has also been underwhelming, especially when viewed from the perspective of the pre-pandemic tax cuts that the government handed to corporates in an attempt to revive private investment and rekindle growth. That the National Rural Employment Guarantee scheme has been seeing record levels of demand is testimony to the struggles those in the rural hinterland have been facing in finding gainful employment since the onset of the pandemic. In the context of the above passage, which of the following are the causes of poverty in India?
  1. Chronic unemployment
  2. Rapid growth of population
  3. Lack of Capital and Entrepreneurship
  4. Increase in Government expenditure
Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 only
2 only
1 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3 only
All of the above

quiz.text:
India was staring at relatively high unemployment — an official report indicated a 6% unemployment rate in 2017-18, the highest in 45 years. Over 12 million people enter the workforce every year, and India has struggled to create new jobs. This trend has now got accelerated. According to the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE), the unemployment rate was 24% in May 2020. It's April data shows that it was predominantly small traders and labourers, followed by entrepreneurs, and then salaried employees who lost their jobs. This is not surprising. If factories and shops are closed, daily wage labourers and street vendors can’t work, and companies begin losing revenues drastically, job losses will result in a declining Labour Force Participation Rate. In the context of the above passage, which of the following are the causes of unemployment in India?
  1. Jobless economic growth
  2. Overpopulation
  3. Poor Industrialization
  4. Disguised unemployment in the Agriculture sector
Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2, and 3 only
All of the above

quiz.text: India was staring at relatively high unemployment — an official report indicated a 6% unemployment rate in 2017-18, the highest in 45 years. Over 12 million people enter the workforce every year, and India has struggled to create new jobs. This trend has now got accelerated. According to the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE), the unemployment rate was 24% in May 2020. Its April data shows that it was predominantly small traders and labourers, followed by entrepreneurs, and then salaried employees who lost their jobs. This is not surprising. If factories and shops are closed, if daily wage labourers and street vendors can’t work, if companies begin losing revenues drastically, there will be job losses resulting declining of Labour Force Participation Rate. In the context of above passage, which agency/organisation is responsible for measuring unemployment in India?
options: State Governments
National Statistical Office (NSO)
Central Government
NITI Aayog
Ministry of Statistics and Program Implementation

quiz.text:
India was staring at relatively high unemployment — an official report indicated a 6% unemployment rate in 2017-18, the highest in 45 years. Over 12 million people enter the workforce every year, and India has struggled to create new jobs. This trend has now got accelerated. According to the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE), the unemployment rate was 24% in May 2020. It's April data shows that it was predominantly small traders and labourers, followed by entrepreneurs, and then salaried employees who lost their jobs. This is not surprising. If factories and shops are closed, daily wage labourers and street vendors can’t work, and companies begin losing revenues drastically, job losses will result in a declining Labour Force Participation Rate. In the context of the above passage, which of the following are/are the characteristic/s of the unorganized sector in India?
  1. It is governed by various Labour Legislations.
  2. Contribution to Provident Fund has to be compulsorily made by an employer.
  3. Fixed working hours for workers.
Choose the correct option by considering the statements given above:
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3 only
None of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements with reference to Gini Coefficient:
  1. A value of 1 indicates perfect equality and 0 indicates perfect inequality.
  2. Gini Index is defined based on the Lorenz Curve.
  3. IMF publishes reports on the Gini index.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
options: 1 and 2 only
2 only
2 and 3only
3 only
1 and 3 only

quiz.text:
Arrange the following committees in chronological order in terms of their formation:
  1. Dandekar and Rath Committee
  2. Lakdawala Committee
  3. Alagh Committee
  4. Tendulkar Committee
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 3-2-4-1
1-4-2-3
1-3-2-4
4-2-1-3
2-1-3-4

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements:
  1. Dadabhai Naoroji was the first to discuss the concept of a Poverty Line in pre-independent India
  2. He used the menu for a prisoner and used appropriated prevailing prices to arrive at what may be called 'jail Cost of living'. 
  3. He explained the Drain of Wealth Theory in his book.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
1 and 3 only
3 only
All of the above

quiz.text: How much food grains beneficiaries are entitled for under Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY)?
options: 50 kg per family per month
25 kg per family per month
35 kg per family per month
45 kg per family per month
30 kg per family per month

quiz.text: National Urban Livelihoods Mission (NULM), an initiative towards poverty alleviation, was initiated by which of the following Ministry of the Government of India?
options: Ministry of Panchayati Raj
Ministry of Rural Development
Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
Ministry of Home Affairs
Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI)

quiz.text: Which of the following best describes the term ‘Learning Poverty’?
options: Unwillingness to come out of poverty.
Unwillingness to engage in more productive work.
The state of being unable to read and understand a simple text by age 10
Transfer of poverty from generation to generation.
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following methods has have been used to estimate poverty in India? 1) Headcount ratio 2) Calorie intake 3) Per capita income 4) Household Consumption Expenditure
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
2, 3 and 4 only
1, 2 and 4 only

quiz.text: In a given year in India, official poverty lines are higher in some states than in others because
options: Poverty rates vary from State to State
Price levels vary from State to State
Gross State Domestic Product varies from State to State
Quality of Public Distribution varies from State to State
All of the above

quiz.text: "Absence of minimum income to get the minimum needs of life" is concerned with which of the following types of poverty?
options: Relative Poverty
Absolute Poverty
Generational Poverty
Multidimensional Poverty
None of the above

quiz.text: The Self Help Groups (SHGs) have been set in India with an aim to help the rural poor, especially
options: Unemployed youth
Women
Children
Senior Citizen
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following factors can be attributed to the growth of unemployment in India?1. Slow growth in agricultural and industrial productivity.2. Slow expansion of the manufacturing sector.3. Concentration of investment in the capital goods industry.Select the correct answer from below:
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
2 Only

quiz.text: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY) is a flagship scheme of the government to "fund the unfunded". What is the full form of MUDRA?
options: Medium Units Development & Refinance Agency
Micro Units Development & Refinance Agency
Micro Units Development & Restructuring Agency
Medium Units Development & Restructuring Agency
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following ‘Sustainable Development Goals’ (SDGs) is correct?
options: Goal 4 is End poverty in all its forms everywhere.
Goal 2 is Ensure healthy lives and promote wellbeing for all ages.
Goal 5 is Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Goal 11 is Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable.
Goal 5 is Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns

quiz.text: What is a poverty trap?
options: A poverty trap is a trap that keeps a community from ever-evolving out of poverty.
A poverty trap is a trap that is caused by the top 5% of wealth ignoring the impoverished nations.
A poverty trap is a trap that happens when you lose a job and cannot find another, thus making it harder to find future work.
A poverty trap is something that happens when a community is uneducated, which hinders them from ever making money.
None of the above

quiz.text: The concept of vicious circle of poverty is associated with
options: Kindleberger
Schumpeter
Ragnar Nurkse.
Gunnar Myrdal
Adam Smith

quiz.text: Which unemployment is considered as good for an economy up to some extent?
options: Cyclical Unemployment
Frictional Unemployment
Seasonal Unemployment
Structural Unemployment
Chronic Unemployment

quiz.text: What does Phillips Curve indicate?
options: The inverse relationship between inflation and unemployment
Income inequality
Impossible trilemma of exchange rate, capital flow and autonomous monetary policy
relationship between tax rates and the amount of tax revenue
Economic Growth

quiz.text: Which of the following statement correctly defies the term ‘gig worker’?
options: Workers outside the traditional employer-employee relationship
Labour working without appropriate remuneration
An employee with written contract of employment for a fixed period
Workers not covered by the social security schemes of the government
None of the above
